website_summaries.verdict: The Inov-8 X-Talon 212 is a racing shoe that can handle both soft and hard terrain. Aside from being a reliable mid-range racing shoe, this shoe doesn’t disappoint when it comes to hiking and obstacle running. It offers a good combination of durability, speed and protection that’s reliable and competent.
pros: The shoe is very flexible and fast, based on some reviews
Some runners found this shoe very versatile
Runners were impressed with the grip of the shoe, which is effective on soft and hard surfaces
The Synthetic mesh in the upper, coupled with a Met Cradle webbing, secures the foot well while maintaining a well-ventilated interior environment
It has the DWR coating that’s water repellant, keeping the foot dry while running on wet surfaces
The mid-sole unit delivers responsive cushioning and propelling mechanics to make each step more empowered
cons: The X-Talon 212was too narrow to some testers
It has a slightly expensive price
The medium level of cushioning left some runners wanting more because they apparently experienced discomfort during extended use

customer_reviews.title: Bomber shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for general trails and fastpacking. They fit well, a little narrow at first but the toebox soon spread once broken in. I run 10km training trails in these, very, very nice grip. Light and drain well. Recently ran 62.5km in them over a two and a half day overnight fastpacking trek. It was hot, then windy, then very wet. These shoes worked well in all conditions and dryed out overnight when stored in my bivvy from my body heat so I had dry shoes the next day. Perfect! I am very pleased with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: M Alfrey

customer_reviews.title: Step Steadier - Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very good off road running shoe. Perfect fit for me at uk10 with tight fit around main foot and more space in toe box to allow comfort. Ran the 3 peaks with zero blisters, cramping or discomfort. Straight out the box. Highly recommend. Still going strong 6 months later. Plenty of life and sole left in them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent overall trail shoe.
customer_reviews.text: First class trail shoes. Took a couple of runs to get used to them. Narrow fit. But superb grip and ultra light. Fast too. Comfortable now I've ran a couple of 6 mile trails. Grip on everything all surfaces. I used for multi terrain incl hard surface and they dealt with it all well.
customer_reviews.author: Bright Horizons

customer_reviews.title: Keep buying Inov8
customer_reviews.text: Inov8 keep updating their product range. The molding in the toe area seems bulkier than normal. Time will tell if this causes any problems. As a family we have now bought over 10 pairs. Used for walking, trail running, fell running & orienteering.
customer_reviews.author: LakesClaire

customer_reviews.title: My go to trainers
customer_reviews.text: My go to trainers for hills, and it appears flat etc too. You can't beat these trainers for comfort and support. Tried other trainers for flat etc, but find they're to spongy or unresponsive or too much movement inside and end up with blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Tricky32

customer_reviews.title: A great trail shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my partner. This is his review below: Used these beauties recently on a 5 mile trail run local to where I live. The terrain was hilly, very muddy, lots of water and a little road. They performed well, plenty of grip on the muddy hills and whilst not design for tarmac roads they performed well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Emery

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly, excellent grip, I wore them for an off-road obstacle course event where I was completely submerged at points and they really dug into the mud and pulled me out of some dire situations!
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable trail shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable trail shoes that fit well especially if you have a narrower foot. Worn twice over 5k trail runs and immediately felt good, no rubbing or pain and good grip. Planning longer run now.
customer_reviews.author: u lundy

customer_reviews.title: Go up half a size - otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: Great trail shoes for the price. I’ve run on tarmac as well as trail/mud in these and they not deteriorated too much. Only criticism is they are a little tight across the top of the foot and toe so I’d recommend going up half a size.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Kesley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best pair of trainers for off track running ever!!! I am super happy with this purchase and I would give full marks for function, comfort, value for money and look too
customer_reviews.author: alessandra tumolo

customer_reviews.title: Superb in the mud and wet ground
customer_reviews.text: These have been a great buy for the recent weather conditions, superb traction on wet and muddy ground my feet feel safely planted in all conditions. I'm size 9 and these fit me perfectly. Great product from Inov8
customer_reviews.author: Andy S

customer_reviews.title: great on muddy soft groung
customer_reviews.text: Important to note it is too soon to review as only done a couple of runs. So far felt a little weird on the roads , great on soft ground and felt little too narrow for my feet. I am looking forward to really testing them on muddy terrain.
customer_reviews.author: craig hales

customer_reviews.title: Great off road shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoe, ran my first Spartan super in these, the terrain was heavy, loads of mud and water off road running for 13k would not have survived without them.
customer_reviews.author: Jabroni

customer_reviews.title: Whitby X Country
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my first ever bash at a cross country. Grip was superb on the soft, slippery course. Guys with road shoes were sliding all over the place. They are dead light, but cushioning seemed fine too. fit was great for me with my wide feet, but anyone who deems their feet to be normal, may prefer the less roomy precision fit. The colours look great too!
customer_reviews.author: philip rutter

customer_reviews.title: A great choice for XC but make sure you wear them in gently!
customer_reviews.text: A great shoe. Word of warning: wear in slowly as I really hurt my calves and achilles after wearing these shoes as I didn't ease into wearing them gently. As they don't offer much support compared to normal trainers, it does take a while for your legs to adapt to them, particularly when racing
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Etchells

customer_reviews.title: Great trail rnning shoe plenty of grip
customer_reviews.text: I've had the shoes a few weeks and after 1 blister on the 1st run they now feel really comfortable and great to run in. Real test will be tough mudder but so far so good
customer_reviews.author: MR LM JONES

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Product as expected. Lightweight & plenty of grip. Great for XC races
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good grip
customer_reviews.text: Did a 24km spartan race in the rain. Very muddy conditions but didn't slip an inch on the entire course.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit well and are very comfortable for use in orienteering
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight with plenty of grip. A little tighter than ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight with plenty of grip. A little tighter than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tighter than older models but still a great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these shoes now for 50+ miles and several pairs of the previous versions (yellow and grey model) for 1000+ miles. This new version I find reasonably comfortable. They are slightly tighter than the older model, which felt odd at first, but with some wear they are loosening up and I think they will actually be a better fit in the long run. Compared to Solomon shows they have a much wider footprint and a more comfortable profile in my opinion. They also don't smell as much as waterproof models as the material is kept light and easily washable. One of the best shoes out there for trail and hill running. Highly rated in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best when muddy.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my talon 190s. These are better made and a good fit although fraction smaller than my old 190s. Would improve with elastic laces.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and decent fit..
customer_reviews.text: I spent ages looking around for a decent yet fair priced shoe,,bought these after reading the reviews and like them..they feel comfy yet roomy as I went for the standard fit, not the precision fit as I thought they may be a bit tight...remember, they are a minimal sole so you do feel everything you run on..stones..branches etc...very little in the way of cushioning...they are very light and hopefully will last a while..did a 10k run off road on Friday and they were fine, no slipping at all over all types of ground...
customer_reviews.author: SD GODDARD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: To allow for thicker socks and knowing this brand tend to come up on the small side I ordered a half size bigger than I would normally take and chose the Standard fit as I have a wide foot (with bunions). I have found them to be extremely comfortably and I'm not easily pleased. The grip held very well on the wet grass I was working my agility dog on, just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: S. READ

customer_reviews.title: ... size 9 in asics and normally there is a recommended finger space between my toe and end of shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm a regular size 9 in asics and normally there is a recommended finger space between my toe and end of shoe. With these it's exact fit that doesn't allow for expansion when feet warm up. Lovely shoe though and great for off road.
customer_reviews.author: paul bennett

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit, excelent grip in a mud
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit,excelent grip in a mud. Awesome looking trail shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Poliak

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I took the advice about upsizing and bought half a size bigger than usual. They fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Superb grip and very light. Get at least half a size bigger than you would normally do.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Sorry Mr Retailer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 11.5 precision from another retailer - other reviews warned they were a little short fitting. They were just too narrow and short so I re-ordered here. This time getting standard fit and size 12 thinking that would be problem solved. Alas the width is now perfect for my feet but the length is actually shorter than the smaller size. This is apauling quality control. I order online to save time not waste it. No complaints about the retailer, sorry they are linked to this error.
customer_reviews.author: Tall Mark

product_meta.title: Inov-8 X-TALON 212, Men's Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: The classic, flexible, lightweight racing shoe that delivers excellent grip over soft or extreme terrain and is super-fast on dry trails too. An off-road running legend that’s done it all. Popular for both racing and training, this responsive yet protective shoe continues to leave footprints on all terrains across the world.
feature_bullets: For running on soft, muddy terrain and harder ground too. Perfect for fell, mountain, trail and x-country running as well as obstacle racing.
Renowned grip: Iconic 8mm studs not only claw through soft terrain but also hold firm on harder ground.
Go light, fast and natural: Weighing just 212g (may change) and boasting incredible flexibility, it complements the foot's natural movement and increases speed.
Versatility: Does it all, over all distances, as proven by the number of championships it has won on mountains, fells, trails and over obstacle courses.
Comfortable ride: Injected EVA midsole ensures great underfoot comfort, even on rough, steep terrain.
